chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul M Pennebecker appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

2:30 PM Defendant Paul M Pennebecker appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with A F
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring with Level 5 supervision; no contact order. If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Paul M Pennebecker appeared by video, in custody at MSDF.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms appeared by video for Paul M Pennebecker.  Attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11. AS TO "HABITUAL CRIMINALITY REPEATER" ENCHANCER IN COUNTS 1 AND 2: Motion to dismiss by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court. State to file an amended complaint. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Response to Staff Attorney.  (Paul M. Pennebecker - #267312, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Response to Staff Attorney.  (Paul M. Pennebecker - #267312, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 8/17/22. Defendant is in custody at MSDF. Needs to be produced for court.  Julie S of coordinator office has been notified via email.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/17/2022@130pm
